alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist; Southern Columbia; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Gilchrist, west central Alachua and south central Columbia Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 645 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over High Springs, or 12 miles southwest of Worthington Spring. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... High Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
